talk.author: did:plc:legt7xows4ec22dhnrmyfde4
talk.utter:
Ehh, not really unless there was some kind of structure to the metadata. 

It sounds like free text and notes and even an LLM will struggle with some sort of categorization. 

I’m not close to the twitter example, but I tried on another free text source and it was only around 30% accurate.

talk.author: did:plc:lui5epjfu4cdbyg6ujyn27tl
talk.utter: I'm curious how you structured it. It seems like you could use a transformer architecture with a multi-class output layer instead of the usual sequence output, and go through the human written reasons and label them into categories? I'll believe it would fail, but it seems like a thing to try.

talk.author: did:plc:legt7xows4ec22dhnrmyfde4
talk.utter:
The sample we reviewed (a few hundred) out of the hundreds of thousands we provided was lacklustre at best. 

We may have been able to do more but the costs at this point, with middling results, were not well received to push further.

talk.author: did:plc:legt7xows4ec22dhnrmyfde4
talk.utter:

talk.author: did:plc:lui5epjfu4cdbyg6ujyn27tl
talk.utter: That makes sense, especially if you were using GPT instead of an open-source model. The API calls I assume get pretty expensive pretty quickly.

talk.author: did:plc:legt7xows4ec22dhnrmyfde4
talk.utter:
It was crazy expensive. We were hoping to use the results to justify hosting our own model (save costs over time) but couldn’t get traction. 

And, even hosting an open source model with GCP is not exactly cheap either. 

Still might happen, but mixed results has put everything on pause.

talk.author: did:plc:legt7xows4ec22dhnrmyfde4
talk.utter:

talk.author: did:plc:lui5epjfu4cdbyg6ujyn27tl
talk.utter: Right, it just takes all the FLOPs, you're probably running on a GPU, which is like 4x more expensive than a CPU, etc

talk.author: did:plc:legt7xows4ec22dhnrmyfde4
talk.utter:
Yeah, the instance types needed to host models in AWS/GCP are all GPU based and nearly as expensive as using external services, perhaps more since initial costs are higher on resourcing (staff, knowledge etc). 

It’s a hard sell right now when money isn’t as readily available.
